jobDescription: Responsibilities: · Responsible for assessing, planning, organizing, administering, documenting and evaluating direct physical therapy patient care in accordance with accepted physical therapy practice and the physician's overall treatment plan.  · Establishes and directs treatment plans carried out by PTA's and ATC's.  · Performs a thorough and complete evaluation of patients properly referred according to Michigan law in order to determine the patient's rehab potential and establish an individually based treatment plan.  · Administers physical therapy treatments to patients according to professional standards and department standard operating procedure in order to maximize the patient's potential functioning level and to achieve treatment goals.  · Maintains and completes accurate documentation, department records and reports for all assigned patients in order to provide a clear record and to communicate patient's treatment plan and progress to the referring physician. Requirements: · Graduate of an accredited school of Physical Therapy (APTA) required.  · Must have current PT license in the State of Michigan  · Current CPR certification.  · Must possess interpersonal skills sufficient to interact effectively with sick and/or irritable patients of all ages in order to gain their cooperation and allay apprehensions.  · Must be able to provide effective instruction to patients and family members.
